Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision rejecting the Applicants' refugee claims based on credibility was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee protection due to fear of reprisals from family and authorities in Nigeria
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected the Applicants' refugee claims based on credibility
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of reprisals from family and authorities in Nigeria
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act subsection 72(1)
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: Board found numerous contradictions and implausibilities in the Applicants' claims; Federal Court found the assessment reasonable
Evidence_Used: Testimony and evidence presented by Applicants regarding fear of reprisals
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Application_Basis: Refugee claim based on fear of persecution in Nigeria
Evidence_Assessed: All evidence considered by the Board, even if not explicitly mentioned
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board's negative credibility determination
Governing_Rule: Credibility assessments by the Board are reviewed for reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Contradictions and implausibilities in Applicants' claims
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; Board's decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of reprisals in Nigeria
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee protection due to fear of reprisals from family and authorities in Nigeria but were deemed not credible by the Board
Evidence_Handling: Board considered all evidence; court found no error in handling
Evidence_Issues: Perceived inconsistencies and implausibilities affecting credibility
Misrepresentation_Element: Implied lack of truthfulness in Applicants' testimony
Evidence_Assessment: Board reasonably assessed credibility based on contradictions and implausibilities
Decision_Rationale: Decision fell within a range of acceptable outcomes based on facts and law
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility undermined by contradictions and implausibilities
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
